rule.description: Windows application informational event.
Windows application warning event.
Windows application error event.
Chrome remote desktop attempt - access denied $(win.eventdata.data).
Chrome remote desktop attempt - Client connected $(win.eventdata.data).
Chrome remote desktop attempt - disconnected ($(win.eventdata.data)).
Chrome remote desktop attempt - started connection from $(win.eventdata.data).
Disk defragmenter successfully completed an analysis.
Summary event of the report's signatures.
Group of MsiInstaller events.
Windows installer began an installation process.
Application uninstalled $(win.eventdata.data).
Application installed $(win.eventdata.data).
Request for product component failed.
Unexpected or missing value in key.
Unexpected or missing value in subkey.
Windows installer restarted to complete a configuration.
Installation not permitted by software restriction policy.
Installation not permitted due to an error in software restriction policy processing.
64-bit packages deployment is not supported for this version.
Windows installer proxy information not correctly registered.
MsiInstaller: Failed to connect to server.
Detection of product feature component failed.
Application cannot be installed.
Update successfully removed.
Update could not be removed.
Update installed successfully.
Update could not be installed.
File in use by another program.
The configuration data registry key, sub key or configuration data cache folder were not secured properly.
The product installation or update required a restart for all changes to take effect.
The application tried to install a more recent version of the protected Windows file.
Assembly component is in use.
Environment variables updated during installation generated an error.
Windows installer installed the product.
Windows installer reconfigured the product.
Windows installer installed an update.
Windows installer removed an update.
Windows installer requires a system restart.
A program accessed information from a location sensor or default location.
Group of SPP events.
Software protection service stopped.
Software protection service scheduled successfully.
SLUI.exe launched.
Proof of purchase installed successfully.
The existing scheduler data does not match the expected data.
License activation (slui.exe) failed.
Application stopped responding, program closed.
Group of Windows search events.
Performance monitoring cannot be initialized.
Internal error generated by a component loaded in the system.
Cannot start update because the content sources cannot be accessed.
Critical Error: System low on resources.
Advise Status Change Failed: System low on resources.
Registry version does not match with the expected one.
Crawl requested to be stopped.
Application network access account invalid.
Cannot flush gatherer files.
Cannot update checkpoint record.
Cannot save gatherer files.
Cannot restore gatherer files from the previous checkpoint.
Cannot read checkpoint record.
Unable to terminate notifications normally.
Directory location invalid.
Disk full, update paused.
Index data cannot be read.
Missing directory configuration.
Cannot read registry, registry keys missing.
The Windows search service started.
The Windows search service stopped normally.
Performance monitoring cannot be initialized because the counters are not loaded or the shared memory object cannot be opened.
The Windows search service removed the old search index successfully.
The Windows Search Service attempted to remove the old search index.
Windows Search Service indexed data for user successfully removed in response to user profile deletion.
Created default configuration for user.
Group of VSS events.
The VSS service is shutting down due to idle timeout.
COM server cannot be started.
Unexpected error returned by DeleteVolumeMountPoint.
Error generated by registry user name definition.
Cannot interpret user name specified in registry.
Safe mode does not support shadow copy.
The EventSystem service is disabled or attempting to start during safe mode.
Volume Shadow Copy Service: COM+ database corrupted, writers will not receive events.
COM+ event system service or COM+ system application service disabled.
Volume shadow copy service disabled.
Microsoft software shadow copy provider service disabled.
Shadow copy 6 timeout.
Cannot find Diff area for creating shadow copies.
Bad return code detected during internal processing of the EventSystem service.
System may be low on resources.
Routine BackupEventLogW called by EventLogs failed.
Sqllib error: Database not simple.
SQL Shadow Copy configuration error.
Sqllib error: Failed to create VDS object.
Sqllib error: OLEDB Error encountered calling IDBInitialize.
VssAdmin: Unable to create a shadow copy.
Unexpected error calling routine.
Unexpected error querying for the IVssWriterCallback interface.
Writer attempted to subscribe in safe mode.
Volume Shadow Copy Service: Writers do not have enough privileges to create shadow copy.
Cluster service does not run under a user with sufficient access rights.
The VSS service is shutting down due to idle timeout.
The VSS service is shutting down due to a shutdown event from the service control manager.
OFO: Directory can't be removed.
Volume Shadow Copy Service Warning: ESENT ERROR.
Error creating or using the COM+ Writers publisher interface.
Error creating the shadow copy provider COM class with CLSID.
Error calling a routine on a shadow copy provider.
System may be low on resources.
Writer did not respond to a GatherWriterStatus call.
Internal inconsistency detected in trying to contact shadow copy service writers.
Volume/disk not connected or not found.
Could not commit shadow copy.
VSS was denied access to the root.
Group of system restore events.
Skipped creation of restore point for $(win.eventdata.data) as there is a previous restore point available.
Failed to create restore point.
Restore point successfully created.
System restore enabled.
Successfully initialized system restore.
Successfully restored system.
Successfully created scheduled restore point.
Group of application error events.
Application faulted.
Fault bucket report.
Group of WMI events.
Event filter could not be activated.
WMI service could not be initialized.
WMI ADAP failed to connect to namespace.
Inconsistent system shutdown detected.
The WMI service failed to load the repository files.
A quota reached a warning value, WMI stopped WMIPRVSE.EXE.
Error encountered trying to load MOF.
Event provider attempted to register a syntactically invalid query.
Event provider attempted to register an intrinsic event query.
Event provider attempted to register query.
WMI ADAP failed to connect to namespace.
WMI ADAP was unable to save object.
WMI ADAP was unable to create the Win32_Perf base class.
The provider has been registered in the WMI namespace.
The WMI service detected an inconsistency with the WMI repository.
The WMI service failed to load the repository files.
Access to namespace denied.
WMI service could not deliver results asynchronously for the namespace.
WMI stopped WMIPRVSE.EXE because a quota reached a warning value.
WMI service was unable to locate the repository files during the service startup.
WMI service started successfully.
WMI core, provider subsystem and event subsystem initialized successfully.
Group of EventSystem events.
EventSystem supressed duplicate log entries for $(win.eventdata.param1) seconds.
Event system failed to create an instance for the subscriber.
EventObjectChange event could not be fired, query criteria contains an error.
The COM+ event system could not fire an EventObjectChange event.
The type library specified in EventClass could not be loaded.
The COM+ event system detected a corrupt IEventClass object.
The COM+ event system detected a corrupt IEventSubscription object.
The COM+ event system detected a bad return code during its internal processing.
The COM+ event system detected an unexpected null pointer during its internal processing.
The COM+ event system ran out of memory during its internal processing.
The COM+ event system detected an unexpected error from a Win32 API call.
The COM+ event system detected an inconsistency in its internal state.
The COM+ event system caught an exception.
The COM+ event system caught an access violation.
The COM+ event system could not store the per-user subscription.
The COM+ event system detected an error trying to query object because the criteria string contained an error.
The COM+ event system could not remove the object.
The COM+ event system could not marshal the subscriber for subscription.
The COM+ event system failed to create an instance of the MultiInterfacePublisherFilter.
The COM+ event system could not apply the filter criteria to subscription because the criteria string contained an error.
Group of desktop window manager events.
Unable to start desktop window manager.
Unable to start desktop window manager due to composited theme not used.
Desktop window manager exited with code $(win.eventdata.data).
Group of Winlogon events.
$(win.eventdata.data) was unavailable to handle a notification event.
$(win.eventdata.data) was unavailable to handle a critical notification event.
User logoff notification for customer experience improvement program.
The shell stopped unexpectedly.
Logon hours restriction policy applied to the logged on user.
Desktop switch failed.
Windows logon process terminated unexpectedly.
Windows logon process failed to disconnect the user session.
Windows license validated.
Invalid Windows license.
License activation failed.
The winlogon notification subscriber failed a notification event.
Winlogon notification subscriber registration cannot be loaded.
The winlogon notification subscriber failed a critical notification event.
The Windows logon process has failed to terminate currently logged on user's processes.
The registry file is still in use by other applications or services.
Group of user profile events.
Unable to load registry.
Cannot find local profile, logging with temporary profile.
Offline caching enabled on the roaming profile share.
Group of ESENT events.
The database engine stopped an instance.
The database engine detached a database.
The database engine attached a database.
Unexpected Win32 error.
The backup was interrupted by the client or the connection failed.
Synchronous read page checksum error occurred.
Unable to read log header.
Database engine started.
Database engine stopped.
The database engine is starting a new instance.
Starting full backup.
The database engine is initiating recovery steps.
The database engine is replaying log file C:\Winnt\system32\wins\j50.log.
The database engine has completed recovery steps.
Log version stamp does not match database engine version stamp.
The database engine could not access a file.
Unable to write a shadowed header file.
Unable to read the log header.
The database page read failed verification due to a page checksum mismatch.
Failed verification for database page read.
An attempt to open the file for read only access failed with system error.
Index cleanup of database initiated.
The secondary index WReplicaSetNameIndex of table ConfigTable may be corrupt.
The version store for this instance has reached its maximum size.
Shadow copy 2 freeze started.
Shadow copy 2 freeze stopped.
Volume Shadow Copy Service Warning: Could not perform a backup.
Customer experience improvement program data successfully consolidated.
Group of CAPI2 events.
Failed auto update retrieval of third-party root.
Failed extract of third-party root list from auto update cab.
Cryptographic services failed while processing the Onidentify call.
Successful auto update of third-party root certificate.
Successful auto update retrieval of third-party root list cab.
Successful auto update retrieval of third-party root certificate.
Reached crypt32 threshold of events.
Successful auto update retrieval of third-party root list sequence number.
Successful auto delete of third-party root certificate.
Successful auto property update of third-party root certificate.
The cryptographic services failed to initialize the Catalog Database.
The cryptographic services failed to initialize the Catalog Database. ESENT error.
The cryptographic services failed to initialize the VSS backup "System Writer" object.
Group of MSDTC events.
Unable to translate the MS DTC error code to the appropiate MS DTC error message.
Permission denied to manage the MS DTC on this system.
Exception occurred while processing control requests from the service control manager.
The MS DTC has the same unique identity as the local one.
MS DTC transaction manager could not be initialized.
MS DTC run out of memory.
MS DTC transaction manager could not be initialized.
Microsoft distributed transaction coordinator service successfully removed.
Could not install the MS DTC service.
MS DTC service could not be removed.
MS DTC log path not found.
MS DTC transaction manager could not be loaded.
MS DTC name object could not be created.
MS DTC user interface server object could not be initialized.
MS DTC user interface server object could not be loaded.
MS DTC user interface server object does not support the requested interface.
MS DTC user interface name object could not be loaded.
MS DTC log manager DLL could not be loaded.
MS DTC log file could not be decompressed.
MS DTC log file is full and cannot accept new log records.
MS DTC log file attributes are invalid.
MS DTC log file has wrapped.
XA transaction manager attempted to locate the "GetXaSwitch" function.
Could not force transaction outcome.
The specified transaction bridge CLSID is not a valid GUID.
Could not force transaction outcome.
An error occurred creating the transaction bridge.
An error occurred initializing the transaction bridge.
An error occurred starting the transaction bridge.
A log client has reported taking a checkpoint.
MS DTC has determined that the cluster service is configured.
Transaction not found.
The transaction is not a child transaction.
The MSDTC TM could not determine if an incoming connection request is from a remote machine.
Either the transaction is not committed or there are resource managers or subordinate MS DTC transaction managers still connected.
Could not resolve the transaction due to an unknown error.
The MS DTC log file is unreadable.
MS DTC encountered an internal error and is terminating.
Could not stop the MS DTC service or one of its dependent services.
Invalid command line arguments.
The MS DTC log file is an incompatible version.
No transaction selected.
Exceeded maximum number of active transactions that the MS DTC log file can accomodate.
MS DTC transaction manager is in an inconsistent state and cannot proceed.
MS DTC transaction manager log write failed.
MS DTC transaction manager start failed.
A resource manager performed recovery.
MS DTC XA transaction Manager object could not be created.
MS DTC XA transaction manager could not start.
Could not locate the MS DTC TIP gateway contact object.
MS DTC TIP gateway initialization object could not be created.
MS DTC TIP gateway failed to initialize.
MS DTC TIP gateway failed to start.
Failed to initialize COM while trying to start MS DTC.
A critical error occurred in an MS DTC component, process terminating.
Failed to convert the caller provided TIP transaction URL into a valid MS DTC transaction ID.
Unable to get the file name for the OLE transactions proxy.
The DllGetTransactionManagerCore function is missing from the OLE transactions proxy DLL.
Failed to connect to the registry on the remote MS DTC transaction manager's system.
Failed to open the registry key containing the list of transaction managers.
Failed to read the name of the default transaction manager from the registry.
Failed to open the registry key containing the name of the OLE transactions proxy DLL.
Failed to read the name of the OLE transactions proxy DLL from the registry.
Failed to start MS DTC via the MS DTC proxy DLL.
Unable to start MS DTC because initialization of cluster support failed.
MS DTC TIP gateway illegal transition.
MS DTC TIP gateway invalid value.
MS DTC TIP gateway encountered error calling CoCreateInstance.
An MS DTC component was unable to allocate memory for a critical operation.
The MS DTC transaction manager sent a TIP "ABORT COMMAND".
The MS DTC transaction manager sent a TIP "PUSH COMMAND".
The MS DTC transaction manager sent a TIP "PREPARE COMMAND".
The MS DTC transaction manager sent a TIP "COMMIT, QUERY, or RECONNECT COMMAND".
The MS DTC transaction manager received a TIP "ERROR COMMAND".
The MS DTC transaction manager received an unknown or unexpected TIP command for an active transaction.
The MS DTC transaction manager received a TIP "ERROR COMMAND" for a "Prepared" transaction.
The MS DTC transaction manager received an unexpected or unknown TIP command for a "Prepared" transaction.
Failed to initialize the MS DTC Communication Manager.
MS DTC is unable to communicate with MS DTC on a remote system.
The MS DTC connection manager is unable to register with RPC to use TCP/IP or UDP/IP.
MS DTC is unable to communicate with MS DTC on a remote system.
MS DTC was not able to allocate a console.
An incompletely initialized MS DTC log file was detected.
Illegal transition caused fatal error.
Out of memory caused fatal error.
Unexpected event occurred on synchronization object.
Unexpected error occurred in the MS DTC XA transaction manager.
MS DTC was unable to bind to the TIP socket.
The MS DTC transaction manager sent a TIP "PULL COMMAND" to another transaction manager.
The MS DTC transaction manager received a TIP "ERROR COMMAND" for an active transaction.
The MS DTC transaction manager received an unknown or unexpected TIP command for an active transaction.
The existing cluster resource for MS DTC is not configured correctly.
The existing cluster resource for MS DTC is of a newer version.
The installation of MS DTC on this node used to be a part of cluster that had a newer version of MS DTC installed.
MS DTC was unable to determine the version of the data associated with cluster support in the local registry.
MS DTC cannot start because it failed to initialize the log file for its first usage after a cluster install.
Could not establish connection to trace transaction.
No transaction is selected.
Transaction not found.
The version of the transaction manager is not compatible for this feature.
The attempt to dump the transaction to a trace file failed.
The initialization of the tracing infrastructure failed.
The attempt to create a new trace session failed.
The attempt to stop the existing trace session failed.
The attempt to flush the existing trace data failed.
The attempt to update the maximum buffer count of the existing trace session failed.
The infrastructure has reported that the number of trace events that have been lost until now is equal to $(win.eventdata.data).
The thread launched to update the trace settings has failed.
The attempt to set the trace specific registry settings failed.
Failed to create a new trace session.
Failed to stop the existing trace session.
Failed to flush the existing trace data.
Failed to update the maximum buffer count of the existing trace session.
Failed to update all the trace settings in the registry.
Failed to load all the trace settings from the registry.
MS DTC transaction manager start failed.
MS DTC failed to load the system restore information.
MS DTC failed to process a system restore event.
MS DTC failed to save the system restore information.
MS DTC has processed a system restore event.
The infrastructure has reported that an attempt to trace an event has failed cause of lack of enough buffer space.
Failed to read the needed name objects from the registry.
Failed to initialize the needed name objects.
Failed to stop MSDTC service or one of its dependent services.
Failed to set the security attributes on the MS DTC service.
Failed to stop the MS DTC service.
Failed to restart the MS DTC service.
The MS DTC transaction manager is in an inconsistent state and cannot proceed.
The account that the MS DTC is running under is invalid.
Failed to set the MS DTC service account information in the registry.
The MS DTC Service is terminating because it didn't startup in a timely manner.
A MS DTC component has encountered an internal error.
MS DTC was unable to start because this version of dtc is less than the least valid version allowable.
MS DTC was unable to start because this version of dtc is not compatible with the version of MS DTC installed on another node of the cluster.
The XA transaction manager is in an inconsistent state and cannot proceed.
Entering MSDTC log storage warning limits.
Leaving MSDTC log storage warning limits.
KTMRM service failed to load the system restore information.
Attempt to freeze the transaction manager failed.
Attempt to thaw the transaction manager failed.
Failed to prepare MSDTC for imaging.
Unexpected error when connecting to the kernel transaction manager.
Unable to create a communication channel to the kernel transaction manager.
MSDTC was unable to migrate its log during Windows upgrade.
MSDTC encountered an error during migration of contact identifiers.
MSDTC encountered an error during Windows upgrade.
The maximum number of asynchronous checkpoints has been exceeded.
The maximum number of log buffers in use has been reached.
MS DTC detected dirty log pages on recovery, and is reconstructing state from other pages.
Received unknown connection manager message type.
The MS DTC XA transaction manager called the XA resource manager's xa_commit function.
The MS DTC XA transaction manager called the XA resource manager's xa_open function.
DTC parameter values information.
The XA transaction manager attempted to load the XA resource manager DLL.
The XA transaction manager attempted to locate the "GetXaSwitch" function in the XA resource manager DLL.
MS DTC transaction outcome is unexpected.
The MS DTC XA transaction manager was unable to perform recovery.
Heuristic damage information.
The XA transaction manager attempted to perform recovery with the XA resource manager.
The XA transaction manager called the XA resource manager's xa_open function.
The XA transaction manager called the XA resource manager's xa_close function.
The MS DTC XA transaction manager called the XA resource manager's xa_recover function.
The MS DTC XA transaction manager called the XA resource manager's xa_commit function.
The MS DTC XA transaction manager called the XA resource manager's xa_rollback function.
The MS DTC XA transaction manager called the XA resource manager's xa_prepare function.
The XA transaction manager called the "GetXaSwitch" function in the XA resource manager DLL.
The MS DTC XA transaction manager could not enroll with the MS DTC transaction manager on behalf of the XA resource manager.
The MS DTC XA transaction manager called the XA resource manager's xa_commit function.
The MS DTC XA transaction manager called the XA resource manager's xa_rollback function.
The MS DTC XA transaction manager called the XA resource manager's xa_prepare function.
The MS DTC XA transaction manager called the XA resource manager's xa_commit function with the TMONEPHASE flag set.
The value of XaTmMinWarmRecoveryInterval is greater than the value of XaTmMaxWarmRecoveryInterval.
During MS DTC installation, the attempt to preserve the old log file failed.
MS DTC has received an invalid message.
The connection manager in a MS DTC component has received an invalid message.
The MS DTC XA transaction manager failed attempting to decrypt information in a log record.
KtmRm has received an invalid message.
Group of .NET runtime events.
The process was terminated due to an unhandled exception.
The description for event ID 0 in source .NET runtime cannot be found.
.NET Runtime failed to load.
.NET Runtime - CLR 2.0 does not support profilers written for CLR 1.x.
.NET Runtime - Fatal execution engine error.
There was an error with the Windows location provider database.
Windows location provider started.
The Windows location provider has shutdown.
Process $(win.eventdata.processPath) has reset policy scheme from $(win.eventdata.oldSchemeGuid) to $(win.eventdata.newSchemeGuid).
Group of application management events.
Assignment of application failed.
The removal of the assignment of application from policy failed.
Application was configured to upgrade another application.
The execution of the setup program for an application failed.
Failed to apply changes to software installation settings.
The assignment of an application succeeded.
The removal of the assignment of an application succeeded.
The launch of the setup command for a program succeeded.
The DNS client service could not contact any DNS servers for a repeated number of attempts.
Group of disk events.
A device has a bad block.
A device did not respond within the timeout period.
The driver detected a controller error.
A stripe set or volume set member listed in the configuration information was missing.
The fault tolerance driver configuration information is corrupted.
The FT set containing \Device\MissingMirror1Member0 cannot be used.
Mirror initialization or synchronization started.
VDS fails to launch provider.
Initialization of mirror failed.
DCOM error.
The diskeeper defragmentation has stopped for drive c:.
The fault tolerant driver detected the system was shutdown dirty.
The driver detected that the device \Device\Harddisk2\DR2 has its write cache enabled.
Data was recovered using error correction code on device \device\harddisk0\partition2.
The driver disabled the write cache on a device.
The file system structure on the disk is corrupt and unusable.
Event created in the application log.
Group of EventCollector events.
The subscription could not be activated on target machine due to communication error.
The subscription has expired and will no longer be serviced.
The subscription could not publish events from target machine to the log file of this subscription.
An event from target machine is lost and could not be delivered.
The subscription detects dropped events.
The open procedure for service remote access failed.
Multiple Windows error application events.
Multiple Windows warning application events.
Group of Microsoft-Windows-SoftwareRestrictionPolicies events.
Access restricted by your administrator by the default software restriction policy level.
Access restricted by your administrator by location with policy rule .
Access restricted by your administrator by software publisher policy.
Access restricted by your administrator by policy rule.
Access restricted by your administrator by policy rule.
Windows application audit failure event.
Windows application audit success event.
MS SQL server logon failure.
MS SQL server logon success.
